title: Automatic dart scoring system
description: Build initial setup using 2 cheap webcams and 3D-printed mounts.
Wrote initial code using blob detection and line recognition in OpenCV.
Realized that blob detection works but is not accurate enough in 2D.
Applied linear transformations to project 3D position to 2D sub-space.
Begun experimenting with AI to recognize darts in an image.
Build improved setup with 4 elevated cameras and a light ring.
Using new setup to create training data for artificial neural network.
rained artificial neural network based on the YOLO v8 framework.
Realized that processing 4 cameras were too computational heavy to be viable.
Created final model with 3 elevated cameras.
Printed and assembled final construction.
Programmed the GUI and game mechanics.

title: Motorized skateboard
description: Designed the basic layout of the components.
Ordered components from Chinese manufacture.
Designed basic circuit for motors and speed controller.
Powered circuit tested with laboratory power supply.
Welded the 30 battery cells together in series of 10 and connect to battery management system.
Designed enclosure for battery pack and electronics.
Machined brackets to mount motors on trucks.
Assembled all the parts.
Programed the speed controller for the given motors and remote.
Tested the final construction.

title: AI generated card game
description: The initial concept was described.
The large language model (LLM) was primed to understand the concept of the game.
The game mechanics were established, including how players draw path cards, and engage in battles.
Used the LLM to create a set of characters, each with unique physical appearances and starting attributes.
Used LLM to create monsters, Items, spells, and potions to provide additional layers of strategy and resource management.
Values for attributes, probabilities, and effects were fine-tuned to ensure a balanced and enjoyable gaming experience.
Used Stable Diffusion, an open source text to image AI, to create illustrations for the cards.
Wrote a python script to automatically overlay stats on cards and create double sided print sheets.
Tested the game and iterated the stats.
Printed the game on heavy cardstock.

title: 3D-printed Settlers of Catan
description: Downloaded files from online community
Repair broken meshes with repair algorithm.
Calibrate printer flow and and bed leveling
Fine tune slicer settings for individual parts
Paint the models
Print the models

title: Chess board
description: Cut woods into strips and glue in an alternating pattern.
Cut and glued border.
Created a case for the pieces.
Acquired dark and light wood for black and white pieces respectively.
Cut again and flipped half the strips.
Milled both sites to achieve smooth finish.
Cut remaining wood into lathe-able pieces.
Turned the pieces.

title: Home Server
description: Research hardware requirements
Order parts and build computer.
Install Network attached storage (NAS) - software
Configure raid for drive redundancy
Open ports for streaming applications
Configure network access
Install docker containers for server application
Configure VPN tunnel for secure worldwide access
Configure virtual machines
Setup Cloudflare tunnel for secure access through custom domain

title: Magnetic organizer
description: Got fustrated that I didn't for all my tools in my dorm room.
Came up with the idea of a universal and scalable organizing system.
Designed the square frame that the bins and items would fit into.
Designed the bottom of the containers and specified the tolerances.
Created SCAD script to generate the frames in all sizes.
Drew a parametric model of the bin containers.
Drew a template for the tool-specific elements.
Came up with the idea of implementing magnets for extra security.
Designed the stackable floors, making it transportable.
Printed the designs and inserted the magnets.

title: Website (version 1)
description: Decided to rewrite my resume, as i wanted to get a student job in the future.
Realized that the classic A4 format is good for printing physical copies, but not optimal for showing the information I wanted to present.
Came up with the idea of creating a website instead, as this was more organized and entertaining due to the interactivity.
Began teaching myself the basic structure of HTML.
Realized that I would need custom styling to achive the look I wanted.
Reshearced CSS and began implementing it to create my desired look.
Came up with the idea of a dark mode button on the page.
Realized that I would need to learn JavaScript to implement the dark mode button.
Briefly dipped my toes into JavaScript and implemented the dark mode button.
Realized that this was a good learning opportunity, but that I could create a better website by leveraging a good javascript framework.
Researched different frameworks and decided to use React.
Tought myself react from scratch and advanced my javascript/typescript skills.
Coded the second version of the website, which is what you are navigating now.
